{{main: The literal meaning of ''Neithan'' is "one who is deprived".<ref>{{S
''Neithan'' is a Sindarin word derived from [[NEK]] "deprive". Its [[Quenya]] cognate is ''nehtanō'' "one deprived, exile whose rights and goods have been confiscated".<ref>{{PE
